title: Obama, local officials huddle over Amtrak crash | TheHill
text:
Obama, local officials huddle over Amtrak crash Getty Images By Jordan Fabian - 05/18/15 01:33 PM EDT 
President Obama on Monday met with public officials and leaders of police and fire departments that responded to the deadly Amtrak derailment in Philadelphia. ADVERTISEMENT The group included Philadelphia Mayor Michael Nutter (D), Sen. Bob Casey (D-Pa.), Philadelphia Police Commissioner Charles Ramsey and Fire Commissioner Derrick Sawyer.
The White House said Obama thanked them “for their swift work to treat the wounded and save lives” following last week’s derailment, which killed eight people and injured more than 200. 
The brief meeting occurred on the tarmac of Philadelphia International Airport, where Obama landed to deliver a speech on police reforms in nearby Camden, N.J. 
The president said last week he was “shocked and deeply saddened” by the derailment and called for increased spending on infrastructure. 
“We are a growing country with a growing economy.
